name: Table
description:
Create and import tabular data into your FigJam files.


Editing cells


  1. Click any cell to edit its contents.
  2. Press ctrl/cmd + enter to create a new line.
  3. Press tab to edit the cell in the next column.
  4. Press enter or click Save to accept changes.


See keyboard shortcuts for more details about navigating cells.


Insert and delete columns and rows


Click any column letter or row number to insert or delete columns and rows.


Sorting tables


To sort a table click any column letter to sort a table ascending or descending.


Resize Columns


To change the width of a column, click the column letter and choose either S, M, or L.


Importing data


You can import data from Google Sheets or an CSV file. Click on the widget name and choose Import.


Google Sheets


  • Make sure you use a shareable link from Google Sheets which is set to "Anyone with the link".
  • By default the first sheet in your workbook will be used. Add a Sheet Name to import a specific sheet.


Changes made to the table will not sync to Google Sheets.


CSV File


  • To import a CSV file click on "Choose file" and select the file you want.


Keyboard shortcuts


To navigate between cells while editing use the following keyboard shortcuts.


  • → : ctrl/cmd + ⇨ or tab
  • ← : ctrl/cmd + ⇦ or shift + tab
  • ↓ : ctrl/cmd + ⇩
  • ↑ : ctrl/cmd + ⇧


For advanced editing, enable "Navigate to cell below on enter" by clicking the widget name and choosing Settings.


Press esc to exit editing.


Changing colour


Change the colour of a table by clicking on the widget name and selecting a different colour.
